Description: Grey steatite scarab, pierced lengthwise, with elytra and humeral callosities marked, and base decorated with a hollow inscription consisting of a kheper-scarab topped by a sun-disc and flanked by two opposed feathers.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: One of the "rather common scarabs of Sheshonk IV., Rakheper" mentioned by W.M.F. Petrie, Tanis ii, Nebesheh and Defenneh, p. 73 § 70, p. 111, pl. xli, 55.
Bibliographic references: Hall 1913 / Catalogue of Egyptian scarabs, etc. in the British Museum (2471, p. 247)
Petrie 1888 / Tanis. Part II. Nebesheh (Am) and Defenneh (Tahpanhes) (p. 73 § 70, p. 111, pl. xli, 55)
Leclère and Spencer 2014 / Tell Dafana Reconsidered: The Archaeology of an Egyptian Frontier Town (p.65-66, p.181, pl.23)
